DataElement.preferredName: Patient Major Surgical Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to determine patient eligibility for clinical trial participation as outlined in the study protocol for questions related to major surgical interventions.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Major Surgical Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Greater or bigger in amount, extent, or size._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Major Surgical Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Greater or bigger in amount, extent, or size.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Greater or bigger in amount, extent, or size.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient had major surgica
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgical procedure within 28 days prior to Cycle 1, Day 1 or anticipation of need for a major surgical procedure during the course of the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgical procedure within 28 days prior to Cycle 1 Day 1 or anticipation of need for a major surgical procedure during the course of the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had any major surgical procedure within 28 days prior to Cycle 1, Day 1 or anticipation of need for a major surgical procedure during the course of the study with the exception of the planned breast cancer surgery that is part of the trial design?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is elective or planned major surgery to be performed during the course of the clinical trial?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery within 28 days of study day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery 28 days prior to day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had any major surgical procedures within 4 weeks prior to randomization or anticipation of need for a major surgical procedure during the course of the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a major surgical procedure within 28 days prior to Cycle 1, Day 1 or anticipation of need for a major surgical procedure during the course of the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient less than 4 weeks post-op after major surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery within 28 days prior to beginning AZD1775?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgical procedures less than or equal to 28 days of beginning study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery within 2 weeks of starting study treatment and has failed to recover from any effects of any major surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgical procedure within 28 days prior to Cycle 1, Day 1 and has not recovered from any effects of any major surgery or anticipation of need for a major surgical procedure during the course of the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgical procedure or significant traumatic injury (as judged by the investigator) within 28 days before start of treatment, or have not recovered from major side effects, or had open biopsy within 7 days before start of treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have major surgery within 28 days of starting therapy and did not recover from any effects of major surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery within 14 days before study registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgical procedure, other than for diagnosis, within 28 days prior to initiation of study treatment or anticipation of need for a major surgical procedure during the course of the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgical procedure, other than for diagnosis, within 28 days before initiation of study treatment or anticipation of need for a major surgical procedure during the course of the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgical procedures less than or equal to 28 days prior to beginning study drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient undergone any major surgical procedure, laparoscopic procedure, open biopsy, core biopsy, fine needle aspirate, or significant traumatic injury, within 7 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has had major surgery, has patient fully recovered and a recovery period of at least 4 weeks have elapsed prior to enrolling on study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery within 2 weeks prior to entering the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 36
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has had major surgery, have they recovered adequately from the toxicity and/or complications from the intervention prior to starting therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 24
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery within 14 days before the first dose of any study drug or be scheduled for surgery during the study period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 27
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had any major surgical procedures less than or equal to 28 days before beginning study treatment or minor surgical procedures less than or equal to 7 days before beginning study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 25
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had any major surgical procedures within 28 days before beginning study treatment or minor surgical procedures within 7 days before beginning study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 26
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had any major surgery within 4 weeks of study drug administration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 28
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery within 14 days prior before the first dose of any study drug or a scheduled surgery during study period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 31
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery (e.g., GI surgery or removal or biopsy of brain metastasis) within 8 weeks before first dose of study treatment or has clinically relevant ongoing complications from prior surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 30
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery within 3 weeks before the first dose of study drugs?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 29
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have major surgical procedure (as defined by the Investigator) within 28 days prior to the first dose of IP?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 33
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have history of major surgical resection involving the stomach or small bowel, or preexisting Crohn's disease or ulcerative colitis or a preexisting chronic condition resulting in baseline grade 2 or higher diarrhea?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 32
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery within 2 weeks of starting study treatment and recovered from any effects of the major surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have any major surgical procedure (defined as any surgery requiring general anesthesia or inpatient care) within 28 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have any major surgical procedure within 28 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 34
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 3 weeks elapsed since patient had major surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 35
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had any major surgical procedures less than or equal to 28 days before beginning study treatment or minor surgical procedures less than or equal to 7 days before beginning study treatment and has recovered from any of the effects of any major surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Therradex - 37
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had major surgery within 4 weeks?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient undergone a major surgical procedure within 28 days prior to the first dose of MEDI4736 (durvalumab) and tremelimumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 38
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had any major surgical procedures in the prior 6 weeks?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 39
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery (e.g., laparoscopic nephrectomy, GI surgery, removal or biopsy of brain metastasis) within 2 weeks before first dose of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 40
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a major surgical procedure within 4 weeks of study registration or anticipation of need for a major surgical procedure during the course of the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 42
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had any major surgery within 4 weeks prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 41
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have at least 4 weeks elapsed since any major surgeries with no evidence of infections?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 44
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a major surgical procedure within 28 days prior to Randomization or anticipation of need for a major surgical procedure during the course of the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has undergone major surgery, have they recovered adequately from the toxicity and/or complications from the intervention prior to starting therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 45
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery other than diagnostic surgery, dental surgery or stenting within 4 weeks prior to the first dose of ZEN003694?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 43
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery within 4 weeks prior to start of treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 46
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgical procedure within 28 days prior to Cycle 1, Day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient received neoadjuvant systemic therapy prior to study entry, is surgery planned to occur greater than 8 weeks following neoadjuvant systemic therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 47
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery other than diagnostic surgery, dental surgery, or stenting within 4 weeks prior to the first dose of ZEN003694 (ZEN-3694) or talazoparib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 48
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a major surgical procedure, other than for diagnosis, within 4 weeks prior to initiation of study treatment and there is no anticipation of need for a major surgical procedure during the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has had a major surgical procedure within 6 weeks from randomization date.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 49
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient undergone major surgery within 21 days of Cycle 1 Day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 50
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery within 14 days before the first dose of any study drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 51
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had major surgery within the past 3 weeks?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 52
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a major surgical procedure less than 28 days before Cycle 1, Day 1, surgical procedure change (including open biopsy, surgical resection, wound revision, or any other major surgery involving entry into a body cavity) or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to initiation of study treatment, or anticipation of need for major surgical procedure during the course of the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 53
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have major surgical procedure (as defined by the Investigator) within 14 days prior to the first dose of durvalumab?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 12/20/22 added alt OID, CCTG and AQT for ticket number CADSR0001818; 8/4/2022: fixed the box symbol in AQT_wz
